website_summaries.verdict: For those who don’t want to fiddle with interchangeable heads.
pros: Includes blades for aluminum, brass, steel, and plastic
Each has its own handle, which prevents problems with inserting blades into the same head
Rotating head for flexible blade positioning
cons: Blades don’t always cut smoothly, leaving ridges behind

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Super smooth swivel and quick-release to change tips. The metal handle feels great, it is coated in a thick gray paint that smooths out the edges nicely. As the packaging says, the two included cutting tips are good for a large variety of materials. The black blade is intended for steel, copper, aluminum, and plastic. The packaging states the silver blade is meant for brass and cast iron, but I cant imagine why it wouldn't also work on plastic. Shank on the included blades is 3.15mm and the detent is 2.08mm. Replacement blades are super cheap, I can see this tool lasting for many years.
customer_reviews.author: K&M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid tool. The handle is aluminum, but it is solid aluminum, not hollow. The bit holder portion of the tool appears to be just as high a quality. It is made in Israel, and is stamped as such on the side of the holder. You cannot beat the price and well worth having a couple of them in your tool box just in case. These deburring tools are so easy to use that once you own one, you will wonder how you managed before. I use them for just about everything except for wood. Thick pipes, 1/4" steel plates, thin aluminum plates, holes holes drilled for cables through ways, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. PinkertonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It Does What It Says.  Get One!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove flash from metal and plastic components. Silly me didn't realize how much practice it would take to get used to the swivel head. It works great but doesn't get into the nooks and crannies of the pieces I work with. Rather than switch between it and a hobby knife I opted to rely on a hobby knife. I'll keep this tool around for that special piece that needs the right tool for the job but for now it remains in my tool box. Good product though and will not dull. I used on a LOT of metal components and it is still very sharp... unlike the hobby knives which I have to buy in bulk.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Sims

customer_reviews.title: Best reamer I’ve found in 6 years.
customer_reviews.text: This reamer is the worst. Ever since I bought this reamer, I have become a snob. I can’t help the look of disgust when I see someone’s plastic reamer. They have me hooked. I bought one for myself, and then one for a friend, one for at home, another friend, a third one for myself when I lost (got stolen) my work one, two more friends later and I have bought seven of these dumb things. If only everything was made with this kind of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Garden gnome

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This tool was a great purchase. I use it to trim down some 3D prints that are printed with ABS plastic. It is very durable and is extremely easy to use. This worked perfectly for my use case and I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I've been using one of these General Tool deburr handles for several years. Tough and robust they stand up to commercial use very well. The handle body is aluminum that has been heavily powder coated with a functional industrial grey paint. The steel quick release collet in pressed into the body. The all metal tool gives a nice solidity and tactile feedback along with adding mass to dampen vibration in the cutting process. This in turn leaves a slightly nicer edge than with plastic bodied deburr tools. When we needed an extra for the shop at work I ordered another here on Amazon. My co-workers love it.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn T. Hangartner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool for deburring coins when I make my rings. DigitDough.com
customer_reviews.author: Jenn & Bill

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong deburring things years later
customer_reviews.text: It gets lot of use, I am a fabricator and always need to knock down any sharp edges on metal after it is cut. This does the job that it is suppose to do. So far it is still holding up strong.
customer_reviews.author: Khamiko K.

customer_reviews.title: Value and functional!
customer_reviews.text: These are the deburring tools I have missed every since I retired from the Engineering field! Perfect deburring, easy to hold and still sharp after several uses. Can't beat for the price! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SAMitchell

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected on plastics
customer_reviews.text: Always used edge of a file but this works much better for smoothing burr from plastic/PVC. Does not gouge the material due to its blade bar that rotates freely in the handle.
customer_reviews.author: C G

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: A better retention system would be nice. The twist lock system unlocks while product is in use and sometimes the metal debur piece comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Deburrs copper tubing just a expected. Get tool to have if you work with copper piping and need to make quality flares and what not. About the size of a pencil and can easily be misplaced. I have lost one already so I recommend buying more then one, I always keep a spare on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool & Nice Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time around for me purchasing a deburring tool. My existing deburring tool grew legs and walked away at work. I hate it when that happens. The General Tool Swivel Head Deburring Tool does the job, includes a spare blade, and the price is right. More and more, I am purchasing General Brand tools. General Tool products are both made well and can be purchased about anywhere, and recently when I requested a replacement part, General send me a whole new tool! What's up with that? General's customer service consistently exceeds my expectations! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: J. Nash

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to your kit of you do any basic metal woking.
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to your kit of you do any basic metal woking. Even if you just drill a hole every now and then, this is a quick and easy way to deburr. I've never changed the blades- I've just used the black one on about everything. Its sharp, keep a pen cap on the end.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works great
customer_reviews.text: There are two blades included in the package. The one that comes in the tool is used for copper, aluminum, plastic. The other is for brass / cast iron. This tool works great. Easy as pie to deburr. I guess we'll see how long it lasts. I've done a few dozen so far, and seems the blade is still in good shape. Apparently you can get replacement blades, but I hope I don't need them too soon. Overall, quality seems good, and is way easier than deburring in any other way. Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: New favorite tool
customer_reviews.text: Cleans up rough edges on jewelry projects like no tools business. Usually for watchmaking but try it to burnish and never go back
customer_reviews.author: CO_der

customer_reviews.title: Good but Bad Packaging - Came with one blade
customer_reviews.text: Looks to be a good product. So far performs well. Only issue I have with it is that the packaging is cheap, molded plastic front with a cardboard back. Meaning that the cardboard back is easy prop out of the plastic so that the extra blade falls out (or taken out).
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Clean plastic edges!
customer_reviews.text: This is essential for making any project involving drilling holes in plastic larger than 1/2" in size. A quick shave around the rim and the burs just fall off and leave a clean smooth edge. Great for inserting grommets for a good seal.
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, easy to use, and faster than having to set up a finishing reamer.
customer_reviews.text: If you've ever made a hole in alloy or polymer and discovered you had a burr to deal with, this is a great tool to have on hand. It's easier, takes less time and often delivers better results than a finish reamer. Not to mention a fair amount cheaper than decent finish reamers I've seen sold for use in mills and presses. Until you try one, it's hard to appreciate how simple it is to use, and just how good the tool does its job.
customer_reviews.author: mr.goodguy

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Very handy but not high quality or durability. Definitely handy though
customer_reviews.author: wizzard007

customer_reviews.title: Great Deburring Tool
customer_reviews.text: Great deburrer, Was a little concerned at the price point that it'd be junk, but that couldn't be further from the truth! Came with multiple...blades? All of them are sharp and this thing is excellent. Provides lots of leverage without bending
customer_reviews.author: Shenanigans

customer_reviews.title: They work great on plastic
customer_reviews.text: Have several versions of the tool, just not with me when I needed one. They work great on plastic, plexiglass or metal. Two different style cutters is nice, but wish you could store the extra one in the handle. It was half the price of the hardware store and theirs was of lesser quality.
customer_reviews.author: CZ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing simple tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple tool, it has good weight and does not feel cheap. It came with a extra tip but that said i don't see how you will need to use it right away...i used it for plastic holes and metal holes and it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: M Carolin

customer_reviews.title: Its OK
customer_reviews.text: Does alright for the 1/2 tubing, but is difficult for 1/4 tubing. It is more of a skill to use this tool, as different places around the tube the tool can cut deep if not held at the right angle. I used it about 50 times when practicing making flares for a mini split. Probably another 50 times would make me a pro.
customer_reviews.author: Sebring

customer_reviews.title: TAKES THE EDGE OFF
customer_reviews.text: I ordered an independent front suspension kit for my 1953 F-100 pickup. I needed to take the sharp edge off of the stamped steel pieces that must be welded into the truck frame. This tool does the trick. I don't know how long it will stay sharp, but they did send an extra blade and I'm sure I could buy more. Worth the money and works good.
customer_reviews.author: jwm1941.dec

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it, better deals out there
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok team, there is better deals out there, it just comes with two blades, no place to storage the blades. Disappointed. Don't buy it, better deals out there for the same money.
customer_reviews.author: Julio Z.

customer_reviews.title: Good deburring tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice and inexpensive hand deburring tool. I like it a little better then a Noga i bought for tight places. But this one is a little harder to hold because the handle is small. The blades are sharp and work well. Definitely worth picking one up.
customer_reviews.author: Ian MazurskyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Only problem I have is it unlocks very easily while using it. Easily solved with electrical tape. Use them everyday.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lovely

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This works just as described. The head spins well for demurring and I like that it came with two different material heads. It is very fluent when using, haven't had any problems so far. It has been a couple months, though I don't use it every day. For the price, it's great. If you want something that will dazzle you, you will have to spend more. But this gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good quick deburr tool
customer_reviews.text: Good deburring tool. Works best on round holes. I use this mostly on mild steel and aluminum. Take care on aluminum as the tool can bite in pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mutton

customer_reviews.title: Good tool!
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool. Makes making smooth edges easier. I use it now for deburring copper tubing on HVAC equipment but I used to work in a machine shop and had the same tool for deburring the edges of machined aluminum plating. Solid tool. Only drawback on this is there isn't any storage for the extra blade that it comes with. I recommend this tool definitely.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Kitchens

customer_reviews.title: Good quality- but only came with one blade!
customer_reviews.text: Actually pretty happy with this tool- it's of good quality and the handle feels nice and solid in my hand. It's easy to use, so no complaints there. Only complaint which is why I knocked off two stars is that it was supposed to come with two different kinds of blades, but mine only came with one.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Turner

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome for PVC and acrylic, not great for steel.
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy handle, works as expected. Doesn't work well with steel burrs, but great for PVC and acrylic. It'll remove really thin steel from around a tub chop, but wouldn't cut through the medium thickness remnants. Had to grind those off.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Williams

customer_reviews.title: Could I bug ya to label each one?
customer_reviews.text: The good: -Small, lightweight. -Relatively inexpensive. -Nice variety of cutting heads. The bad: -Wish they labeled the tools. I have to use the included reference guide to know what each color does. It's annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce T. Bufford

customer_reviews.title: A necessity if drilling holes in metal in the field.
customer_reviews.text: Anyone that drill holes in metal in the field should have one of these. Works on sheet metal, and aluminum and steel. Will not leave marks like a file. Just rotate it around a few times and the burr or flashing is gone. Tip can be fragile as it is very hard metal, so don't drop it. It does come with two tips. A protective case would make this complete.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Makes deburring easy.
customer_reviews.text: Best tool for deburring copper pipe. Works like a charm. It took me a minute to figure out how to hold the tool correctly, but once I figured that out, I was very happy about the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T. Clark

customer_reviews.title: I like this it fits my hand well
customer_reviews.text: I like this it fits my hand well. It works well with soft metal but no so good with steel. Probably it is the tips and to be honest I purchased these because it came with two tips and was cheaper than two replacement tips for my old deburring tool. Proving once again you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Brian in Mohnton PA

customer_reviews.title: useful tool with good grip
customer_reviews.text: first shipment came with a somewhat tempered packaging and missing spare blade, but they replaced it immediately and I like it a lot. It's sharp and the swivel is smooth. The handle is long enough for a good grip and not too big or small for me. Very useful tool to have if you do a lot of drilling and din't wanna use worn out ones in the workshop. Very worthwhile investment!
customer_reviews.author: yy

customer_reviews.title: Very poor blades
customer_reviews.text: Useless due to very poor quality steel in the cutting blades. It dulls instantly on anything other than soft plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Legare

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: First time buying one and I am glad I got it.........worth the price and good quality
customer_reviews.author: Pierre A. Lonewolf

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done, but I have used better deburring tools
customer_reviews.text: Somehow these tools always leave a chattery surface on anything but the smoothest straightest edge. This one seems to be more chattery than others I have used. But it works, and sometimes it's the easiest way.
customer_reviews.author: Tad

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool for your 80% lower
customer_reviews.text: Bought for deburring my billet 7075 ar15 80% lower. Works great and easy to use. The end swivels to get to those hard to reach places.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyD

customer_reviews.title: Dont be afraid to buy this one
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool better than the bigger diameter tools u get at the supply house. Cuts just as good but fits alot better in the tool bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They help
customer_reviews.text: Am only using the one for plastics, It is doing a good job. Maybe in the future I will try the other ones.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Live Without It
customer_reviews.text: An absolute must in any metal shop. This handy product has been around for years. My old piece gave out after 20 years. This one should do as well, since it is very well built and is rugged enough to survive my lab techs.
customer_reviews.author: human

customer_reviews.title: You'll wonder how you lived without it.
customer_reviews.text: I should have picked up one of these years ago. Sharp blades cut cleanly and leaves a smooth edge on holes and sawed edges. I use it to clean up 3D prints and aluminum parts I fabricate for 3D printers and other uses.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rehorst

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tool
customer_reviews.text: No complaints so far so good does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.author: Edge shan

customer_reviews.title: works great on plastics and creates a smooth
customer_reviews.text: works great on plastics and creates a smooth, rounded and finished edge, especially on HDPE, which is cuts like butter. ABS is a little chattery. A far better means to round off edges than a sander.
customer_reviews.author: Jon the Art Guy

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: I had a plastic handled version the deburring tool that broke. This one looks much more robust, but it does not have some of the features the other did. No place to store extra bits, no telescoping bit holder. I haven't ever used the telescoping bit holder function, but the handle that holds extra bits would be nice. For the price this is a good tool.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer #375

customer_reviews.title: works every time and comfortable handle as well
customer_reviews.text: Use this to debur Aluminium and steel. Also used on abs, works every time and comfortable handle as well. Nice addition to the tool bag
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This little tool will cut metal like nobody's business. Fits the hand well and cuts with a small amount of pressure. If you find a con, your too dame picky.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool, expensive replacement heads
customer_reviews.text: I really like the metal handle, feels much better than the plastic ones. Unfortunately, the replacement heads are very expensive, so might just buy a new tool when I dull the heads, which, hopefully, won't be for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Curran

customer_reviews.title: Machinist's hobbiest's Friend.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy tool to have to de-burr holes in materials much easier and faster. Cutter edge should last a long time for home use. Easy to hold and well made. Will remove too sharp an edge for you like a professional can. GT& I is a good quality Company.
customer_reviews.author: FixaLot

customer_reviews.title: Very nice deburring tool
customer_reviews.text: Very nice deburring tool. I primarily use this for cleaning up 3d prints, but have seen good results on aluminum parts as well.
customer_reviews.author: arc

customer_reviews.title: Reviews are right
customer_reviews.text: Good quality tool. Only problem was that the extra blades slipped out of the package while being shipped. The package itself should be stapled or taped shut
customer_reviews.author: Review1

customer_reviews.title: The Right Tool for the Job
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well-built, the deburring tool is perfect for removing the burrs left behind by the drill. Compared to other technqiues I have used for deburring--filing them off or scraping them off manually with a much larger drill bit--this tool is terrific.
customer_reviews.author: D Anderton

customer_reviews.title: Good for metal, not very good for plastic
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's designed for, but the finish gets rough on plastic so I bought another deburring bits. For metal, it gives a smooth finish. Made in Israel.
customer_reviews.author: JPN850R

customer_reviews.title: just get one
customer_reviews.text: must have for anyone doing metal work.... i dont know how i went so long without one of these
customer_reviews.author: Rphill

customer_reviews.title: They debur
customer_reviews.text: The tips unlock, and I keep rotating the unlocking collar during use. I may be the problem, but a redesign may be due.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but its small and sturdy. good purchase
customer_reviews.text: works really well, no place for extra blade, but its small and sturdy . good purchase. I am a HVAC technician and use this tool about 5-6 times a month for install's or repairs and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: WaterLemon

customer_reviews.title: Great for deburring holes drilled in cars
customer_reviews.text: Item as described by seller and delivery was quick. Only comes with one blade as others have mentioned. Bought this to replace the one that went missing from my toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Average Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for deburring
customer_reviews.text: Easy way to deburr. Only difficulty is tracking when deburring outside of pipe end. Inside pipe and straight edges are a breeze to deburr.
customer_reviews.author: Baby Sumo

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a good product, though the blade will wear quickly when used on steel. You can expect average wear with aluminum which is what I mostly use it one, it leaves a nice dull edge and removes burrs cleanly. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easily de-burrs, not fancy but solid tool.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. If you drill or cut metal, this will change the way you de-burr. Quick, easy. Not fancy, but solid.
customer_reviews.author: J. Boutelle

customer_reviews.title: ... similar plastic ones that always broke this one is nice because it’s solid metal and I expect it to
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had similar plastic ones that always broke this one is nice because it’s solid metal and I expect it to last
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Slim handled deburrer
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this type of deburrer, with the slim handle, to the typical fat-handled ones. In fact, there are a few rare ones out there with an even narrower handle, but this works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: K-Bear

customer_reviews.title: I like that it's a metal body and that it's long ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very decent little tool and is built of quality. I like that it's a metal body and that it's long so you can get good leverage out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Barss

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This item is absolutely necessary if you are working in the trades and need to clean out conduit/pipe on a regular basis. The other journeymen I work with get jealous when I use it and frequently ask if they can borrow it. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: FriscoDisco

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Extra blade is nice and it fits in the handle. Takes alot of revolutions for heavily burred holes, in fact, i hit the hole with a chisel or grinding wheel first. Good buy for installing rivnuts.
customer_reviews.author: Dong Cheadle

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I really like the feel of this is my hand. Very solid and heavy. Blade holding action works very smoothly. Made in Israel. Comes with two very sharp blades. With the little use I've given it it has worked great. Really awesome for deburring large holes that you don't have a countersink for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need
customer_reviews.text: Great deburring tool. Use at work when doing sheetmetal projects.
customer_reviews.author: Pitdog35

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Needs better ID
customer_reviews.text: Nice deburring set. My complaint is you have to memorize the colors to the material or leave them in the package so you know which one to use. The handles should show what they are for.
customer_reviews.author: rich mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: One blade only
customer_reviews.text: Only came with one blade, not two like the picture or packaging states. Works good though
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This will save you time
customer_reviews.text: Good design, solid construction, smooth action, sharp, hard blades. This tool is easier and leaves cleaner edges than files. Made in Isreal.
customer_reviews.author: dend

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool
customer_reviews.text: possibly the most useful tool for metal, plastic, composite, and wood work. removes all of the little burrs in circular holes. sounds a bit one-use, but you'll be amazed how well it works and how often you will use it. I bought two - it's that good.
customer_reviews.author: I.B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this debuting tool. It's all metal and the blade is locked in. It doesn't fall out until you want it to. The only problem is I wish it had a spot in the hand for extra blades
customer_reviews.author: Steve V

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: You really don't need to buy the blades for steel, the ones that come with it do just fine on the 2 inch rigid conduit I cut and thread daily.
customer_reviews.author: Caden W.

customer_reviews.title: If you drill holes in wood / metal, you need one of these.
customer_reviews.text: If you do projects that require drilling into things. This is a must have tool.
customer_reviews.author: David Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Does the job of cleaning the lip when you cut with a tube cutter a pipe. I used it on 1/2" galvanized water pipes. It cleans nicely around pipe and inside the sharp metal sharts left from cutting or threading. A little pricey, but it does a better job than the countersink. I recommend using both.
customer_reviews.author: Electrical Residential Service

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This tool is so tiny and useful, I love it
customer_reviews.author: AGTR14

customer_reviews.title: Works good. Nice size
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Nice size. Fits in my hand perfectly. Wish the handle was made out of rubber or had a rubber sleeve of some sort though. Would recommend for easy use.
customer_reviews.author: GodSon

customer_reviews.title: Handy Tool with many uses
customer_reviews.text: Used these for years now, just needed another to make it easier to find one when I need it, This a trusted brand and I buy from them whenever possible. Fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: John M Rubin

customer_reviews.title: Actually feels like you're holding a tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality tool. It does exactly what it says it does. I used it the first day I had it to smooth over some knock-out holes on the shop lights I was hanging - worked great! It has a nice weight to it so you actually feel like you're holding something in your hand. Should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S Ditto

customer_reviews.title: Simple and quality
customer_reviews.text: This tool is great. It does it's job perfectly. I wish it came with more blades, as the ones that it takes are bigger than the normal ones. It still does a great job for me though. It's super high quality and doesn't feel like it will crumble in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Removes burrs and sharp edges easily. Have used it quite extensively on steel and aluminum and the cutter is still sharp.
customer_reviews.author: mike0841

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS TOOL
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb tool! Instead of using my Dremel each time, this is quick and easy to remove burs from inside coin rings.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool why don't they make the blade out of a hardened steel? We are shaving copper!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony fischer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pipes, PVC, and 3D prints
customer_reviews.text: Great all-around tool for pipes, PVC, and 3D Print clean up. It glides around edges very easily, and it makes me not afraid to buy cheap pipes, of use support structure on my 3d prints. I bought this after seeing a video from EL Products on YouTube,but the one used there was double the price for something that looked very cheap. This feels like a very high quality product, and it pleased my needs for deburring every time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ogra

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Cuts the burr off the inside of the pipe just like they say. Quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful! Got to have one!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I didn't have one. I was removing burrs using any kind of tool you can imagine and it was difficult, took forever and didn't look good... This tool does what it claims to do and does it well. Got to have one if you do any DIY and plan to drill holes on sheet metal, cast metal or plastic.
customer_reviews.author: L. Panagis

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, should stand up to hard use better than the plastic handled ones.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to deburr some holes drilled into the aluminum body of my Land Rover. Cut through the aluminum burrs like butter, nice and clean holes after a few roundabouts with the tool. Also comes with a replacement. Don't hesitate to buy if you're doing any metal work.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: A good basic tool
customer_reviews.text: A basic, common tool at a reasonable price. As a hobby machinist, this deburrer works well with the small aluminum, soft steel and plastic parts I have made. I was pleased at how well it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, single purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Handel is aluminum with a heavy duty steel insert, for the bit holder. I'm expecting it to last about forever. Holds the bit much more securely than the adjustable debur tools. There is no noticeable wiggle or play.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Goff

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what you'd expect
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it is designed for. Purchased to smooth out the edges of holes I was drilling in a hard plastic case. Worked beautifully. Like the solid construction a nice plus. Feels like a tool.
customer_reviews.author: Hokie115

customer_reviews.title: Great tool needs a compartment in the handle for the extra blade.
customer_reviews.text: This works well for trimming off burrs on sheet metal. I only wish they would make a compartment in the handle for the extra blade.
customer_reviews.author: Roger L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: All the General Tools I have do a good job and the debur tool is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love it and if needed I'll happily buy again. Makes plumbing almost a pleasure
customer_reviews.author: SteveDC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very handy for clearing out the 'fuzzies' off my 3D prints.
customer_reviews.author: helloimgil

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool. Two different heads for different material. Swivel is nice and the locking mechanism works well also.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

product_meta.title: General Tools 484 Swivel Head Deburring Tool Kit

COLOR CODED HANDLES- use GREEN for aluminum and copper, RED for brass & iron, BLUE for stainless steel, and YELLOW for plastic
HIGH STRENGTH STEEL BLADES- for long-term, durable use
POCKET CLIP- for on-the-go jobs and uses
